name: Oak Bank Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was our first hotel stay with our 15 month old baby and I was looking forward to it and dreading it as I expected her to scream the place down/ cry all night and even prevent us from eating the included dinner some evenings. Instead she was lavished with attention and fuss and was even taken of our hands so we could enjoy our main course in peace. One night when she had had enough they even brought dessert up to our room so our monster could nibble my cheese board. Deciding what to eat at dinner was a serious deliberation, if I could of stayed longer to try all the meals I would of. The menu was extraordinary and every bite full of flavours and taste. I am no expert but I KNOW it was that good! Our hosts were lovely the service made you feel like a lottery winner and the room was a comfy warm delight. Also for those with children you could pop 50 yards to the right of the building to tire the little one out at the lovely park, stroll though the village with all its shops and cafes or hop on the bus and abandon the car to get everywhere! A perfect stay!! Forgot to mention sherry nightcap was delicious!! We never got around to trying the leisure facilities, to much to do!
reviews.title: Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second visit to this hotel stayed 2 nights this time - Rooms are clean and well presented, albeit you will find better else where - at a price!
reviews.title: Best Value in Grasmere?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Owners are very hands on and offer brilliant service.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: Last year we stayed at the hotel next door - The Grasmere - great experience, I understand the hotel has now refurbished most of their bedrooms. However if you like food - THIS IS THE PLACE - 4 Courses brilliantly presented - better than much more expensive hotels I have stayed - can't understand why anybody would want to book here for bed & breakfast only?
reviews.title: Small hotel with great attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Couple of nice comfortable lounges with real fires - drinks reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Oak Bank Hotel Grasmere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For consistent quality look no further than Oak Bank. Following our seventh visit in just over two years the welcome is just as warm and the hospitality first class. You've read about all of the lovely little touches (Bath House products, sherry in the room, canapes before dinner etc.) well these along with the attention to detail by Glynis, Simon and their staff amount to a very personal experience and potential visitors to Grasmere will be hard pressed to find their equal. Once again we stayed in the very comfortable Acorn Suite which is at the front of the hotel on the ground floor and even though it was a busy Bank Holiday weekend it was very quiet. There was shared cameraderie with a walking group who regularly use the hotel and we have both returned home saying what a great time we have had. With a special birthday coming up this time next year I hope it will be a repeat performance!
reviews.title: Our kind of place ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our second stay at the Oak Bank, and just as good, if not better, than the first. We stayed for four nights in a superior plus room which was lovely: clean, spacious and a very comfy bed. Love the little touches, the sherry, fresh milk.
reviews.title: Another excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was once again outstanding, delicious and beautifully presented.
reviews.title: Great food but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely stay, thanks to Glynis , Simon and all the team for great service - and we don't have any problem with " The Rules"...!!
reviews.title: oak bank hotel grasmere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: As another reviewer has already said, the reviews seem to fall into two categories: "the vast majority of guests find it excellent, but a very small number find it very poor". I fall into the latter category and would not return.
reviews.title: Oak Bank Hotel, Grasmere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first visit on the recommendation of Trip Advisor.The hotel is a little gem. The staff are friendly, hard working, attentive, accommodating, and professional - lots of little touches that some may not notice. We felt really welcome. The food is outstanding - beautiful presentation, expertly prepared and the quantity perfect after a day out on the hills. The location is wonderful and ideal for exploration of the area around Grasmere - even in snow and ice! There is a bit of 'tidying up' needing doing in the bathroom of the room in which we stayed, but nothing that detracted from our enjoyment of Oak Bank. We recommend this hotel very highly.
reviews.title: Pretty close to perfect for our needs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Havng just returned from yet another stay at Oak Bank Hotel I was more than suprised to read reviews that were not more than excellent.. ..which was very suprising. It is however not suprising the differences in expectations....how on earth do hoteliers cope with such differences in opinion and not take these critisms personally..... well done you. In the meantime myself husband and family having nothing but praise. ....what an excellent accommodation and little bit of luxury in the lakes....... even if there where some small pointers...... and there must always be constructive critism ... otherwise how would this world go round. .... I would not voice to allow others to critise unnecessaryily ... and needless to say this is one traveller who will contine to visit this hotel without concern of quality or accommodation or cuisine...which I must say was second to none. Book me yet another room ... well done
reviews.title: Credit where credit it due!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second visit to this hotel and we were again very pleased with the stay.
reviews.title: Second Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean and the beds comfortable. The food is of 'fine dining' quality and portions, but there was enough to satisfy after a day walking in the area.
reviews.title: Lovely Place to spend New Year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weather was very cold, but the hotel was kept warm, An open fire in the comfortable lounge next to the dining room was a good focus for after dinner drinks and talking to other guests.
reviews.title: Fabulous food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Simon and Glynis are not only professionals running a deservedly successful business but also amateurs in the original sense of clearly enjoying what they do. It's a powerful combination.
reviews.title: A Happy Return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was our second 3 night stay prompted by very positive recollections of our visit in March 2012. Our memory was not at fault. The location is good, parking is easy, service is excellent, our welcome was warm and the atmosphere relaxed and friendly.
reviews.title: wet weekend of luxury!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the highlight is, as before, the food. To use a well-worn term, the team "punches well above its weight" and, one might add, at a price below its worth!
reviews.title: Helen J

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We understand that after four years a new head chef is about to come into post. We are confident that the Woods will have recruited well and look forward to experiencing the next stage in their culinary journey.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Country Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Well...the weather was terrible ...thank god for the wonderful Oak bank Hotel.We walked as planned straight from the hotel, perfect location,returning like drowned rats.
reviews.title: Couldn't have looked after us better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another excellent stay with the quality marked by the hands-on approach of the proprietors. Very comfortable & welcoming with an unrivalled quality of catering.
reviews.title: An excellent value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent our 3rd New Year at the Oak Bank Hotel. It's like coming back to family as many of the faces are the same. The hotel is extremely well run by Simon and Glynis and their small friendly team. Nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are well appointed and it would be a pleasure to stay in any one of them. The meals are superb and fresh. We will be back again next New Year and are due to return again in the next few weeks.
reviews.title: Excellent New Year Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really would recommend this hotel and it's cuisine. The atmosphere is intimite and exceptionally friendly. The food is fantastic. The owners/staff are extremely likeable and helpful. The location is ideal and it's very quiet. The open fires are fabulous after a long walk and fabulous meal. It offers great value - especially if you choose the dinner bed and breakfast option.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't have a criticism!
reviews.title: Recent Stay at Oak Bank

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing but praise for the hotel. Simon and Glynis and their staff make you feel very welcome and full marks must go to the Head Chef and his staff in the kitchen for the magnificent food that they produce. The menus were constantly changing and each course was better than the previous one. Superb.
reviews.title: Still first class!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a 3 night weekend break including dinner each evening. We were delighted with the experience and have only knocked off one star because the en suite was cramped. It would, therefore, have benefited from having a shower rather than a bath. Moreover the bath controls did not work properly.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having got that out of the way, we can only award plus points all round for location, service, comfort and value for money. The hotel 'punches well above its weight' in terms of its food. The menu changed daily. The principal ingredients were locally sourced and the dishes (and the chef's 'extras') were presented with many additional touches and refinements. This was fine dining modestly priced. An extra benefit - and one rarely experienced - is that Oak Bank operates a 'flat pricing' policy across a very decent wine list; so that we were able to enjoy a Faiveley Côtes de Beaune and a Jadot St Véran each at around £25 a bottle.
reviews.title: It Just Gets Better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Glynis and Simon are to be congratulated and should be supported - though not to the extent of prejudicing our future bookings.
reviews.title: A little gem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: We have just returned from our fifth stay at this hotel. Each visit we wonder if it can better our last visit but once again Simon and Glynis have done it again! Room 15 was the best room so far and the food and service superb.
reviews.title: Small Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The food quality and service here is better than we have had anywhere. We have booked another visit for next year but am sure we will return later this summer as we know we cant beat it for value and enjoyment. The attention to detail is wonderful and the Easter Eggs a much appreciated gift!
reviews.title: A great location with fantastic food and a friendly atmosphere.
Well worth a visit
reviews.text: Have stayed here several time. Always been happy with accomodation. The food is always excellent. Would always recommend this hotel to visitors to the lakes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: We loved this little hotel in the centre of Grasmere. We didn't move our car from the front of the hotel during our two night stay in February 2012, until we had to dig it out of about 6 inches of snow to go home! We had a standard room which was nicely decorated and the snifter of sherry in the room a lovely touch. We also slept really well - there was a large group staying the nights we were there but they didn't disturb us at all.
reviews.title: Outstanding food in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The highlight of our stay, however, was the fantastic food. We opted to eat in the hotel both nights as part of a deal we found on their website, and we're really glad we did. The four course menu was original, tasty and of outstanding quality. My husband declared the chocolate fondant 'the best he'd ever had' and every dish was beautifully presented. The service was also excellent, and we enjoyed relaxing in the bar before and after our meals.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel and food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: I rarely go back to places, but I would definitely go back to Oak Bank. It was absolutely amazing value and the food so memorable, just writing this makes me want to head straight to their website and book another weekend away!
reviews.title: Exquisite food with world class service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an amazing time at this wonderful hotel. The food is outstanding, the head chef and his staff deserve an enormous amount of credit as it was truly delicious. The proprietors were really friendly and the service was excellent. We had a standard room which was perfect for our needs - it was well decorated and comfortable with a great view. The location is great - in Grasmere but on the edge of some breathtaking scenery and walks. This hotel thoroughly deserves an excellent review. Well done, we will be back!!
reviews.title: Food omg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: Lovely hotel with excellent fine dining and friendly service. Great value for money. We booked another holiday whilst we were still there. The wine is good at a reasonable price and Grasmere is as beautiful as ever.
reviews.title: Fabulous little hotel that punches above its weight - fantastic food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed at the Oak Bank Hotel in the past I thought ir would be a good opportunity for myself and my wife to take a much earned break from work and stay somewhere were we had good memories.
reviews.title: Disappointing Short Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I duly booked the hotel for Bed and Breakfast then waited for the day we could set off for our break. On arrival at the hotel, all looked the same as it did from years past and it was setting foot inside the reception areas that things looked up. However I should have picked up on the receptionist asking what time we required our table for dinner, as so I thought we had not booked a table but just thought it was a well timed comment so we booked for 7:15pm and went to freshen up after a long drive down from Aberdeen.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The menu was limited but a strong compliment of starters and main courses followed either by a sweet course or cheese board. The choice of wines are excellent and went well the the chosen meals. The cheese board in particular was excellent.
reviews.title: fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However things started to go array the next day when on departing for a days walking we were asked again at what time we required table for dinner to which I replied we didn't as we would be dinning out. On the following day we again departed for a days walking and on return was confronted by the hotel owner who, in front of other guests started to berate us for not returning in time for dinner. Again I stated that we had not booked for dinner, bed & breakfast but that did not seem to satisfy him as he continued to berate us in front of the other guests. It was at this point that we stated that there was obviously a mistake in the booking and we would sort it out in the morning as it was now late and we were both tired for the day out.
reviews.title: Three night break

description: Nestled in Grasmere Village in the heart of the English Lake District, Oak Bank Hotel is perfectly placed to explore the surrounding lakes, fells and tarns. Oak Bank has two lounges both with plenty of comfy sofas and armchairs to relax in. The front lounge has a converted range and the bar lounge has a real log/coal fire. Breakfast and dinner are served in our Two AA Rosette awarded beautiful dining room and conservatory.
